description: Buy the Coleman Backroads 30-Can Soft Cooler Tote online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Backroads 30-Can Soft Cooler Tote
hasVariant.description: Buy the Coleman Backroads 30-Can Soft Cooler Tote online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I’m so bummed about this bag. I love the look of it, and it’s the perfect size to haul food and drinks to an outing. But after using it just one time, the seam on the inside ripped and now the insulation is visible and things can fall into the lining. It’s basically unusable after one outing. Truly bummed.
review.name: Bummed
comment:
Hi there!

Thank you for contacting Coleman, the Outdoor Company, and for taking the time to provide feedback on our Backroads™ 30-Can Soft Cooler Tote. We're sorry to hear that our soft cooler did not live up to your expectations because after the first use, the cooler seams ripped and the insulation was visible, making the product unusable. We appreciate you for bringing this to our attention. We apologize for your negative experience with our product. We work passionately to achieve such satisfaction from our customers by continuously improving our products and services. As we are looking for ways to better our product and service, we always ensure that consumers' feedback and concerns are shared with the concerned department. If you have any further questions or concerns about your product, such as its warranty, please visit the Coleman website, click on the question mark logo in the upper right corner, select contact us, and you will be directed to our contact form. Thank you very much, and have a wonderful day!

review.reviewBody: I needed a big tote that I could shove multiple food storage boxes into. I can even put smaller bags inside this big bag, for example, my small beverage tote that holds 3 hydroflasks gets shoved in on the side next to the food containers. It's sturdy, padded, insulated, so it won't tip over. It's also nice-looking, with unisex styling and extra storage pockets on the outside for silverware, napkins, etc.
review.name: perfect carryall for all my food and bev

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The HERITAGE SOFT COOLER 30CAN TT GREY SIOC was alright.  It’s function with the strap was nice.  If you are having ice in the cooler for a couple days, it will leak. We took it camping and it did it’s job, but leaked at the bottom.  I did really like it other than that.   If you are using it for a day trip, it would work.
review.name: Good

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We picked this cooler up for a throw in the car, head to the pool, or go visit someone and take some cold drinks with you. Perfect size, keeps everything cold , and not bulky like a hard cooler. Very happy with this little gem
review.name: Love this thing

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the fabric and look of this cooler.  It has a canvas exterior that keeps water and dirt off. The inside of the cooler is leak proof and the materials are made to prevent mold and mildew.  I take this cooler with me when walking to a lake spot, picnic, camping or movies on the lawn. This cooler keeps my cold items cold for a full day so no worry about our drinks getting warm!  The cooler is easy to carry and has an adjustable shoulder strap and handles that have padding for comfort.  This is an all in one carrier as pockets on the outside can be used for you purse essentials, keys and phone.  You can also keep your lotions and water handy in the outside pockets.   This cooler will last through many many advertures!
review.name: Great Coleman Cooler!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This cooler bag works great! It keeps things nice and cool for a long time. We put cold sodas in in the morning and they stayed pretty cool for most of the day. The straps are long enough that u can carry it over your shoulder without distorting your arm to get it on. And it is soft on the outside.
review.name: Make it last

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The soft cooler is fantastic. You can take your beverages anywhere you go. The design is attractive and made of high quality material. The cooler can be taken to your work space or to a picnic. It definitely keeps your beverages cold. I pack some apples in the cooler as well. I truly recommend the product.
review.name: Great Item

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great new cooler from Coleman that looks great and works great. Never had a tote cooler before and I love the versatility of it. Being able to wear it instead of having to carry it is a great convenience wherever you are going. The tote itself looks great and made of quality material that will last a long time and has pockets on the outside as well for other small items you may need. The inner has a great lining to keep your items cool and it's very easy to clean. Ice packs are easier but you can easily put ice in here as well with no problems. Tote is nice size and can hold up to 30 cans. Overall great cooler for trips to the camping, beach trips, BBQ or picnics
review.name: Great stylish cooler!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We love to camp and having to carry around a hard sided cooler can be a pain. I’m absolutely loving this Coleman heritage tote cooler. We used it when we went fishing and camping and it fit our food and drinks so cold! It can fit up to 30 cans of pop but we use it for food too and it works fantastic! It keeps our cold and frozen stuff cold for around 24 hours. The handle is padded so it’s more comfortable.
review.name: Durable and portable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This cooler is okay as maybe a picnic cooler.  I put some ice in it and a couple of cans of water and kept it in my warm garage and the next day they were warm.  They were cold the day of, but it didn't take long for the ice in the cooler to melt on a hot day.  I would not say it is a 24 hour stay cold cooler.  Also, while this bag has some little pockets on the front and back for a non bulky items (phone, keys, utensils) and two stretchy pockets on the side for bottles this bag looks like a diaper bag.  I don't think many men would want to carry this bag around.  Some other positives is it wipes clean on the inside and it has both a shoulder and two short handles. It is pretty if you are looking for more of a fashion bag cooler, if not stay away.
review.name: Just Okay
comment: Thank you for posting a review. We appreciate you bringing this to our attention and we are sorry that our Coleman® HERITAGE SOFT COOLER 30CAN TT GREY SIOC didn't meet your expectations. This is not the experience that we want you to have. We will make sure that our design and production team are made aware of your feedback. We are always looking for ways to better our product and services, and your feedback would certainly help us in improving it moving forward. Should you have any question regarding the warranty or would like to obtain warranty service, please visit Coleman website, click on the headphone logo on the upper right corner, choose contact us and you will be routed to our contact form.

name: Backroads 30-Can Soft Cooler Tote

hasVariant.name: Dynamic Sling
hasVariant.description: Buy the Beal Dynamic Sling online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Some of the strongest slings out, nice feel, and dynamic.  Held up well so far ( 6 months ).

I use 120 & 150 to equalize ground anchors for leading rope solo, also 150 makes good top rope anchors. 60cm is used to extend gear via tie ins, but looking at the dynamic pas as an upgrade. 

My primary pas is a 150cm sling with an 8 and overhand. It's about 2x the length of my metrolios dyneema pas with piece of mind due to rating / dynamic. I generally use it to clip into bolts before I go to clip and definitely prefer this to my previous dymeena 

--edit: recommended for trad. Using these instead of screamers for lower rated pieces. Definitely gives a piece of mind. The 60 can be slung normally, but recommend wrapping the larger sizes
review.name: Good for Anchors and PAS

name: Dynamic Sling

review.itemreviewed: Free Aero RC Classic Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: I am so glad to see that Castelli fixed the strap issue, where the straps were easily punctured by your finger(s) when putting the bibs on. And although I was hesitant about the lack of leg grippers and thus the longer shorts, they feel great.
review.name: They fit and feel great

review.itemreviewed: Free Aero RC Classic Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Used these on a couple 70 mile rides and the padding is excellent . Good temp regulation as well. Has a premium feel. The raw cut edges are fine... nothing gets out of place. Very happy with the purchase.
review.name: Excellent pad

review.itemreviewed: Free Aero RC Classic Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Beautifully made...fantastic construction....Castelli is my favorite.  The odd thing though with this one is the shoulder strap length.  I'm 6'1" and wear an XXL in Castelli because they run small.  I own an older Castelli bib in the same size.  Fit in the waist, crouch...perfection.  HOWEVER, when I tried to pull the straps over my shoulders, they were so unbelievably tight that I swear they would have ripped out of the bottom after some use.   Not an inexpensive garment so I decided to return it.  I'm sure I'll find something else from the website soon.
review.name: Bib is for those a little shorter!

review.itemreviewed: Free Aero RC Classic Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Medium fits very snug, especially in the legs. I have larger than average legs for my build so I am taking that into account (59.7cm/23.5in).

Since this product is billed as aero it will run tighter anyway. Despite the snugness, the bibs still fit without stressing the seams. If you buy your size instead of one up they will fit like a skinsuit, which is fine if you're okay with that.

Personally for me, I feel if I went a size up the straps would sag on the shoulders.
review.name: Super Tight; Size Up

review.itemreviewed: Free Aero RC Classic Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
5'8" at 161 lbs. Purchased size L. 
Happy with the fit. It's snug without struggling to get it on.
review.name: Usual one size up for Castelli

name: Free Aero RC Classic Bib Short - Men's

description: Buy the Gregory Targhee FT 35L Pack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Targhee FT 35L Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Targhee FT 35L Pack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Fits beautifully, well-constructed and designed, useful features, very comfortable for backcountry cross country ski trips
review.name: Fantastic day pack for cross country

review.reviewBody: The pack got it all except an insulated sleeve for the hose to the water reservoir.
review.name: Great pack.

review.reviewBody: Great pack! Fast track works better than other skimo style carry systems I've used (mostly it's just more secure than the loop + hook method - I've had skis fall out from the metal hook before). And the pack itself is a good pack for my use, although I do find that all of the straps are way longer than necessary, so I'll be trimming them because they tend to get caught on stuff. My one real complaint is that the "U zip" that lets you open the backpanel is missing. I understand that the fast track system as currently implemented would get in the way of a u zip back panel, but I'd love to have both. Maybe fast track could be tweaked to accommodate it. The u zip of the regular targhee 45 really helps make accessing the packs contents quicker and.more convenient.
review.name: My new springtime backcountry pack

review.reviewBody: This pack fits me extremely well and the fast track feature is great.
review.name: Great Fit

review.reviewBody: Haven't had a chance to use it skiing but the ski carry strap works great, one handed operation as advertised.  Excited to use it this coming season!

I love this backpack. Incredibly intentional design with a lot of thought and creativity. I am really petite and this pack fits so well, which is difficult for me to find, even working at a backcountry ski shop. Highly recommend.
review.name: Great design

review.reviewBody: Hands down my favorite piece of gear I've ever owned! Plenty roomy for a full day in the backcountry, and I've taken it out numerous times on overnight ski trips (huts and tent camping both). It has every feature I want and nothing extra to get in the way. It carries surprisingly well for such a light pack and the S/M fits my petite frame nicely. The fast carry is not the most comfortable but it's super convenient for a quick boot. It's also my go-to ice climbing bag, as it has plenty of room for layers, the ice ax attachment is simple and effective, and the rope carry is excellent. Thanks to Gregory for designing the perfect winter bag!
review.name: The Perfect Winter Pack

review.reviewBody:
Wow!  You can certainly tell that the people who engineered this product are actually outdoors people themselves.  What a terrific idea to be able to stow my skis without having to remove my pack.  This is due to the FastTrack friction hook system.

It has been expertly constructed using lightweight, removable components so that I can “customize” it for my own particular needs.  The anodized aluminum hardware makes it functional in cold weather and easy to use even with a gloved hand.
 
I appreciate the sternum strap with integrated safety whistle and a total of 4 external pockets including a front quick-access pocket  and a zippered security pocket on the underside.
review.name: The Targhee FT35 is my favorite pack!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] First of all, some of the reviews say this is too small to pack and survive in the snow for several days. That is correct. For a day of skiing, it is perfect. Everything in the bag has a purpose and it is well-designed to be so compact and so useful. I will definitely use this for backpacking as well as skiing because it is much nicer than my other backpack!
review.name: PERFECT Pack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice medium bag to have for a day trip in the Rocky Mountains. Good storage in the large, main pocket with many smaller, convenient pockets for easy access to things. Good quality in the materials, strong zippers and ties. Easy to get to attachments for skis or helmets! Lightweight even when loaded. Good hydration tank as well.
review.name: Comfortable

name: Targhee FT 35L Pack

description: Buy the Primus MicronLantern w/ Self Igniter online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: MicronLantern w/ Self Igniter
hasVariant.description: Buy the Primus MicronLantern w/ Self Igniter online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
This tiny lantern starts easily and give off plenty of light and heat which is useful for winter camping in an enclosure.  Be careful if using in a tent, but it will keep a 2 person backpack tent warm.  Be sure to leave vents open if using in a tent.  The original mantle lasted two years and was replaced with a Coleman slip on #51 mantle.  If the mantle develops a hole, hot gasses will jet out and impinge on the metal screen causing it to glow red and that will weaken the screen at that location over time.  Change the mantle if that happens.
It will also run on 1 lb propane cylinders if car camping if you get an adapter that screws onto the lantern.  I would recommend getting the fold out base for the 1 lb propane cylinders to provide more stability for the assembly since it is now much taller than when using the smaller backpack fuel cells.  No issues with the lantern so far and I bought a second one just in case, but the original is still working very well.
review.name: Rugged and Compact

name: MicronLantern w/ Self Igniter

description: Buy the Salomon Soft Flask 400ml Water Bottle - 42mm online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Soft Flask 400ml Water Bottle - 42mm
hasVariant.description: Buy the Salomon Soft Flask 400ml Water Bottle - 42mm online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Filled with ice and water and inside belt it stays nice and cool for about 1.5 hours at 30 degrees Celsius. Solid build
review.name: Keeps water cool for about 1.5 hours

review.reviewBody: I really like the product, but it has this disgusting smell of rubber or plastic that makes the water taste unbearable. Is there a way to get rid of the smell?
review.name: It smells and tastes like plastic
comment: I am really sorry for this inconvenience, please contact our customer service to provide you assistance.

review.reviewBody: We've been using these flasks for more than a year now and really like them.  The keep water from freezing and are easy to use and VERY easy to clean.  But, they have another great feature: no bite valve.  The importance of that feature escaped me until I was lucky enough to get braces in my late 40s (once in my teens was apparently not enough).  These flasks are now the only ones I use given how sore my front teeth are.  I continue to highly recommend these flakes to everyone but especially if you have braces.
review.name: Just a quick use update...

review.reviewBody: Having had bladders and soft flasks freeze on us in the winters, we were excited to give these a try.  They seem to work really well.  No issues at all with freezing (even when we've been in the shadow of the mountain for hours).  We've not tried them in the summer yet so can't comment on their ability to keep things cold.  The only other thing I think that's worth mentioning is that there is a bit of a learning curve for drinking out of them (at least for me): don't squeeze them too hard as you prepare to drink or you may end of squirting yourself in the face (as I did).  Which, while amusing, isn't terribly effective at hydration.
review.name: A great cold (and hot?) weather option

name: Soft Flask 400ml Water Bottle - 42mm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I feel like a walking advertisement for the Lono! I can't stop telling everyone about how much Iove it, and all of its awesome features. This thing is freaking perfection, and I am so happy with my purchase. It's solid as a rock, and so stable. It tracks perfectly, and the seat is super comfortable. I get tons of if compliments while I'm in the water, because it's so good looking. Set up is quick and easy, as is breakdown. I looked at a bunch of inflatables, and im so glad I chose the Lono. Because of how easy it is to throw it in my SUV and go, t's going to have me on the water a lot more. Thanks Bote, for a great product.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love it! Minus one star because its first water test revealed a pin hole leak, which was disappointing but easily fixable. Looking forward to putting many miles on the apex.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like it a lot but I was a little bit bigger / heavier than expected. That’s the only negative thing. Besides that it’s awesome! Great looks, strong and firm!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The kayak is amazing and sturdy and very easy to maneuver. The only issue I have is that the first use of the Apex Pedal Drive the screws on the swivel hold downs that are usually holding the pedal port cover down slightly pulled out and they are now loose and let the peddle move slightly side to side when paddling.
review.name: Great kayak, just one issue

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Didn't want to pass up the Memorial Day sale and bought 2 kayaks, one for me and the husband. He really likes his. Took it out on the creek to try some fishing on it. Handled great! It was fun to just pedal around on.
review.name: Didn't want to pass up

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Absolutely love it! I’ve had it on the water at least six times now with no issues. It’s well engineered and constructed. Easy to inflate and assemble. I use this kayak primarily for exercise and quick access to the water. Highly recommend.
review.name: Lake time.

review.reviewBody:
So these things are pretty tight. They're metal so can probably bend a bit over their life but they are difficult to get bottles into and out of. Great for mountain biking where you want your bottles extra secure and probably will only drink when stopped. Not so ideal for road bikes if you want to grab a drink while riding. 

Ironically then, I can only use them on my road bike. You can't really side pull these. You gotta take it straight out. If you have tall bottles and smaller clearances then you're not gonna be able to make it work. Small bottles though will be fine unless you have a really small frame and need a full-on side-pull anyway.

These do look pretty cool though. I especially like the matte, which matches my bikes.
review.name: Tight, for better and worse

review.reviewBody: They're cheap, they never lose bottles, and you can get them in multiple colors. What else is there to say? I run these on gravel and mountain bikes and have never lost a bottle, and they've held up over thousands of miles.
review.name: My go-to cages

description: Buy the SealLine Pro 70-120L Dry Pack online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Pro 70-120L Dry Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the SealLine Pro 70-120L Dry Pack online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Bought this pack for BWCA trips (and will use it for other trips as well). Inaugural trip with the new pack was 3 nights, 4 days last week. Was sick of carrying a wet pack, and having the exterior of my inside dry bags always damp. Long story short, this pack exceeded expectations. Strap system works great and is fully adjustable, the pack floats, hip strap is substantial and adjustable. Packed for my family and i in this 120L and was able to single portage carrying the canoe (1500 rods in total). The placement or angle of the top of the pack is adjustable so i could get it behind the yoke to hoof the canoe and pack. Also used this pack to hang our food. Couldnt speak more highly of this pack.
review.name: Perfect pack for BWCA or other paddle-ventures

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag primarily to use on canoe expeditions. For longer portages, the harness system is extremely comfortable and better than other packs I have used. The pack has been used in all sorts of conditions and it has been very waterproof and I never worry about the contents of my bag getting wet. So far after a busy season and many trips, the bag has proven bombproof and I would buy it again if I ever need a bag like this.
review.name: Great canoe pack

review.reviewBody: this pack did great in bush alaska, being thrown in a small plane, in the at , boat and on a canoe trip. it’s comfortable to carry for miles and sturdy enough to go anywhere.
review.name: comfy for all the rugged places

review.reviewBody: So glad I decided to buy the pro it has been such a comfortable upgrade from my regular dry back I love the waist straps… worth the $!
review.name: Beat dry bag

review.reviewBody: I will be putting up a review of it on my blog here in the near future!
review.name: Great Gear!

review.reviewBody: Love this pack. So far it’s held up well on several River and ocean adventures in Alaska. Hip belt and straps are excellent. Occasionally I get nervous about the plastic clips but that’s not unique to this pack. Also the 120 L I have is huge which is nice for certain trips and consolidating gear.
review.name: Great Pack for Alaska

review.reviewBody: The material seems to have changed to a lighter weight (on the pro). Have to see how that is from a durability standpoint. The hip belt, shoulder straps, and back venting is better than ever! Nice work! Wasn’t the first choice colour (orange) but high vis is always good in the bush. Thanks for the great product
review.name: The material seems to have

review.reviewBody: We bought these bags for our hunting trip to Alaska in august of 2023. We haven’t had the chance to use them yet but have prepackes them and they are more than we’d really expected size wise. Everything that we plan on taking fits well inside these bags with plenty of room for the extras we haven’t planned on taking. We are looking forward to trying them.
review.name: We bought these bags for

review.reviewBody: Love the color - would have actually like it to be more around the 50 - 60 liter mark as it's just slightly bigger than what I would have liked but you don't make that size in this particular product line.
review.name: Love the color - would

review.reviewBody:
This is exactly what I expected.
 the material is thick and durable without being to stiff. I expect it to last many backcountry trips in the rough granite terrain of the Boundary Waters.

review.reviewBody:
I had an issue where these shows did not nicely fit. I contacted Backcountry Customer Service. The Return and Replace was immediately processed, NO Hassle. 
I got my shows sooner than expected.
review.name: Backcountry is Fantastic!

review.reviewBody: I’ve really liked these shoes and bought them 3 times, but they seem to fail pretty quickly. I use them for mountain biking, XC as well as more technical backcountry riding, and the front soles start peeling off in less than a year without fail. The kicker was my most recent pair started peeling away after about 4 months and then the Boa cord snapped so they were no longer usable.  I’m trying out a different shoe now similarly priced from Fizik that seems better.
review.name: Don’t last long

review.reviewBody: I’ve been riding mountain bikes for a VERY long time and these are the Goldilocks. Fit is great with excellent heel retention. Single BOA and a velcro strap makes adjustments simple. Sole is plenty stiff for power transmission without being uncomfortable for all day rides. Good grippy soles (unlike Sidi) for those times you have to hike a bike. And made from a sturdy material that is easy to clean. Just a great all around shoe.
review.name: Favorite Shoes So Far

name: XC502 Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Mtl Long Sky 2 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Exactly what I need for my upcoming Camino de Santiago walk.  Love the wide toe and secure foot support but also allows my feet to breathe!  I think these are winners!
review.name: Winners!

review.itemreviewed: Mtl Long Sky 2 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: These shoes became a part of me so I could become a part of the trail. No clunk, no chunk, no tripping. We were flying. Upon first strap-in the upper is a little tighter and stiffer than the Matrix version, it was squeezing into one of my arches. That disappeared the moment I started running- they flex and move great while still maintaining a reassuring level of security. Even after swelling later in my run they never got tight or squeezed at all. I did notice that, while these feel incredible during the run, the initial feelings of slight pressure in my arch returned during walking after my run. Contrary to some store's sales slogans, not every running shoe makes a good walking shoe. So I will be using these strictly for the running days and not the intervals - which suits me fine because I need alternating shoes, but that is why I gave four stars instead of five. That will probably dissipate as they get worn as well. The toe box isn't a box shape or flared out but there is plenty of space- it isn't heavily tapered and with the flexible upper I never felt a lack of room, and I have fat toes that swell big. No debris filtered in, the "sock" fit around the ankle is spectacular. I think if you don't like a huggy fit it would not become shifty or long if you went up half a size - these are wonderfully short shoes, which is what helped eliminate the tripping. Looking forward to hundreds more  miles in these!
review.name: My New Best Friends

review.itemreviewed: Mtl Long Sky 2 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: The shoe disappoints.  The good is that it has good support, looks good and fits according to size.  However, it is hard to put on because the laces are only decorative, and the shoe fits like an unyielding slip on.  It's so stiff, that when you take your shoe off, the insole jack knives out of the shoe!  When worn, the shoe, though nice and light, is unyielding, feeling like upper rubber in the toe area.  I'm sorry that I was so enthralled with the look of the shoe, that I wore it outside, instead of trying it out inside, so I obviously can't return it.
review.name: Disappointed
comment: Apologies that these did not work out for you. If you need assistance, please give us a call at 800-288-3124.

review.itemreviewed: Mtl Long Sky 2 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these in January 2024. The fabric on the uppers is already falling apart. They were comfortable but for the price paid I would expect them to last more than 4 1/2 months.
review.name: Poor quality material for uppers.
comment: We stand behind our products and we'd love to do all we can to help. We have a 1 year warranty on our products for any manufacturing defects. Please visit our ‘Contact Us’ page at the link below and fill out the Warranty Form to start a claim. If you need any assistance with the form give the team a call at 800-288-3124. Thank you. https://tinyurl.com/bdcuxst9

review.itemreviewed: Mtl Long Sky 2 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Awesome shoes! Great grip, water drains well, a little wide for me but heel lock lacing makes all the difference. I have only tried them in training, but they will probably be in my choice of shoes for next race.
review.name: Good job Merrell!
comment: Thank you for choosing us!

review.itemreviewed: Mtl Long Sky 2 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Awesome. Extremely comfortable, perfect for wide feet.
review.name: MTL long sky 2 blue/orange
comment: Appreciate your positive feedback!

review.itemreviewed: Mtl Long Sky 2 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I've bought many Merrell shoes and been very happy.  This design however does not work for me.  The tongue is sewn to the shoe, making it extremely difficult to put my foot into the shoe.  My socks ride up and become very tight around my toes.  The seam on the tongue curls under, creating a bulge over my arch which is uncomfortable.
review.name: Sewn in tongue is horrible
comment: We're sorry to hear about your experience. Your feedback is important to us, and if we can help please give the team a call at 800-288-3124.

review.itemreviewed: Mtl Long Sky 2 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Merrell died not disappoint.  The comfort is super, the support not as prominent as in the Moab 3’s but this is a lighter shoe
review.name: Cool and comfy
comment: Thank you for the great review!

review.itemreviewed: Mtl Long Sky 2 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I got these for my birthday and I love them! These are so comfy. You can feel the traction working on rainy, icy days. I'm going to buy another pair!!
review.name: Great!!
comment: We love this! Thanks so much for your support!

review.itemreviewed: Mtl Long Sky 2 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Just received and tried them in the house. No arch support, actually made my feet turn in. Very flimsy and surprised by this as this is not Merrell quality. Sending back unfortunately. Pros, the color is gorgeous and they are wide if you need a wide fit. Also found the sizing to be off. Very large for a 7 1/2.
review.name: Not the best quality
comment: Thank you for sharing your feedback Fiona.

review.reviewBody: Light weight backpack that's very comfortable and a great choice for beginners to advanced hikers looking for a smaller pack.
review.name: Gregory Paragon

review.reviewBody: The gregory paragon 48 is an amazing choice for a hiking backpack, especially with the breathable mesh and metal rods in the fram to redistribute the weight to your hips instead of your back. Its very comfortable and a good choice for any kind of outdoorsman wether its a beginner or an expert since the bag isnt too complicated to figure out. If i had to nit pick and change one thing id add more pouches and pockets.
review.name: Comfortable and capable

review.reviewBody: I have used this bag multiple times was everything i expected and great features. Large side stretch pockets and large stretch back pocket. Right side pocket has convenient hole to access water bottles in and out without having to remove pack. Nice waterproof rain cover which works great has a hook and strap to keep from coming off. Great bag comfortable and light.
review.name: Everything inexpected.

review.reviewBody: Was able to fit enough supplies for an overnight backpacking trip including tent, sleeping bag, extra food, and camera equipment. Everything feels fairly durable. Only complaints are that I can't reach waterbottles in the side pockets while the pack is on and waist pockets aren't big enough to hold my phone. Overall pleased with this backpack and looking forward to taking it out again in the future.
review.name: Great backpack

review.reviewBody: I used this for a couple weekend backpacking trips. Great backpack with lots of organization options. Could have more supportive/comfortable straps, but overall amazing pack.
review.name: Great lightweight backpack

review.reviewBody: This bag feels like it was built in order to be used intuitively. Nothing too fancy. Only cons I have for this bag are the male/female clips size concerns me as they are small and seem fragile. Secondly, a hole in the top of the bag for a bladder hose to go through that isn't the main compartment opening.
review.name: Lightweight, versatile & user friendly

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased this pack to go on a 5 day 88 mile hike and it was perfect. Super comfortable and breathable on my back. The hip belt adjusted very well to take the majority of the weight.( My pack weight was 28 pounds with full food for five days  and 2L of water) I encountered some rain as well but, this pack stood strong with its included rain cover. I also found myself using the empty backpack as an additional pillow which was very comfortable. It is not the lightest backpack on the market but it sure is comfortable and with its 48L capacity it is the perfect size for a 5 day adventure.I look forward to many more miles with this pack and I strongly recommend this pack to anyone! Great job Gregory!
review.name: Great 5 day pack

review.reviewBody: Lightweight and fits well. I like the simple design. Very comfortable to wear.
review.name: Solid lightweight backpack

review.reviewBody: Great pack. I love how it fits and carries weight well. I like the streamlined size of the 48L pack. Easily do a 3-4 day backpacking trip while packing some luxury items.
review.name: Just what I was looking for...

review.reviewBody: Took this pack with the family on several day hikes and had plenty of room to pack rain jackets and extra clothes for my wife and 3 kids as well as a picnic lunch, first aid kit, sunscreen, bug spray, etc. Included rain cover worked well to keep things dry. Side access zipper is a great feature that came in handy numerous times. The pack is comfortable to carry for extended periods of hiking, too.
review.name: Great Backpack!

name: Paragon 48L Backpack

review.itemreviewed: MX238 Wide Gravel Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I own road and gravel versions of these.  Fit my wide feet better than any shoes I’ve ever owned
review.name: Lake shoes rock!

review.itemreviewed: MX238 Wide Gravel Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I like the way Lake shoes fit my feet. These are no different, but the tread pattern is horribly laid out. I had to trim the rubber so my SPD pedals could engage. Pretty absurd that they don’t accept one of the most common formats.
review.name: Bad tread design

review.itemreviewed: MX238 Wide Gravel Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I had been eyeing these for so long. The suede exterior is awesome. That’s about where the good stops. The heel is so loose. The insoles are awful. The cutout the cleat bolts line up in is angled very weird (a straight mounted cleat would mean your toe is pointed outward at an extreme angle). Also the cleat mounting is pretty far forward, I heard being able to mount the cleat further back was an advantage to these shoes but they are way more forward than my specialized. The boa’s create a good hot spot. The overall shape and fit of the shoe is just a bit awkward also. I would return them if I hadn’t already mounted cleats
review.name: Meh. Way underwhelming for cost

name: MX238 Wide Gravel Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I mean, how much is there to review? But saying that, they're machined to very exacting tolerances, like all I-9 hardware. They fit snugly on the axle while still being easy to pop off when you need to remove them, so 5 stars for the lowly little endcaps!

I was a little miffed that the torque cap endcaps from my old I-9 Torch hubs didn't fit the Hydras, but I guess that's the cost of progress. Looking at them, I understand the engineering reason for the change, so ok - the new axle design should reduce wear on the bearings.
review.name: They're endcaps...

review.itemreviewed: Nucleo High II GTX Wide Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I haven't worn these on any hikes over 2-3 miles yet but they fit perfectly out of the box.  I am so happy with the nonslip Vibram soles!  They provide security on downhill walks over rocks!  I have worn Salomon for 15+ years and really like the fit and Goretex but can be a bit slippery.
review.name: Fit is perfect!

review.itemreviewed: Nucleo High II GTX Wide Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought these a month after foot surgery. Ordered my regular size 10 in a wide. I hike quite a bit and had a pair of Asolo, which were great, but too narrow. These La Sportiva's are so comfortable, I love them!!!
review.name: Great Hiking Boot

review.itemreviewed: Nucleo High II GTX Wide Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: The wife absolutely loves them. Best boots she’s ever owned.
review.name: Exceptional

review.itemreviewed: Nucleo High II GTX Wide Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I tried this on at a store and bought here. Most heel cushion in any boot worn. Wide toe box worked very well. Love the brand.
review.name: Best boot yet

review.itemreviewed: Nucleo High II GTX Wide Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Wore these during a 6 mile hike in the snow. Comfortable, no blisters or rubbery, great traction & ankle support. The wide width provided plenty toe space without appearing clunky.
review.name: Great traction in the snow

name: Nucleo High II GTX Wide Boot - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Signature Light Weight Short-Sleeve Jersey - Women's
review.reviewBody: Just want to say the only reason I returned it was because too small.  I am 5'3" 120 lbs 36 " bust. I bought a medium. Medium normally works all the time. They did not have a large and I only wanted it in the pink golden dot style. Otherwise, it was beautiful light material and the style was well done. I did not want it in the blue, have too many other jerseys in blue.
review.name: golden jersey

review.itemreviewed: Signature Light Weight Short-Sleeve Jersey - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought this jersey when the temps in Salt Lake consistently were in the upper 90s. I've done a number of rides in this jersey, and so far I really like it! The sleeves aren't as long as some of the trendier jerseys, and the collar feels a bit high and tight sometimes, but it keeps me relatively cool, and the shoulders fit nicer than some other jerseys (which have a roomier fit). The color is very cute and I've gotten compliments on it. I also care about tightness of pockets so all my snacks and phone are secure, and I feel good about these pockets. The sizing is also pretty consistent with other womens jerseys, not particularly over-tight or loose. Overall, a great jersey!
review.name: Great fit on a summer jersey

name: Signature Light Weight Short-Sleeve Jersey - Women's

review.reviewBody: Waterproof, comfortable, sturdy. Absolute favorite shoes.
review.name: Great walking shoe

review.reviewBody: The strap across the top of the shoe tongue is too tight, even with the laces completely loosened. I returned the shoes.
review.name: Too Tight across the top of the air

review.reviewBody: Initially, this shoe was perfect for the multiple uses I had intended to wear it: Walking around campus, a little light trail walking, running errands, etc. The GTX material means it's not very breathable during the summer months, but it's moderate plushiness makes up for it in terms of comfort. To me, it was a versatile, all-around, great sneaker. However, one of the shoes randomly developed a very loud "squeak" about 4 months after purchase. I believe an air pocket developed in the sole, but I cannot be certain and despite my research, I cannot make it stop. Unfortunately, the squeakiness has made the shoe nearly unwearable as I have to walk in an uncomfortable way to make it stop. As I stated, I initially loved these shoes. They were everything I had wanted and expected. But the squeak drives me, and the people around me, so insane I honestly don't know if I'd ever invest in Hokas again.
review.name: Initially great, but its squeakiness drives me insane

review.reviewBody: Loved these at first, but the strap on my shoe broke in two months. Squeeky noise won't go away. Probably the worst hokas I've owned! Save your money for some different hokas.
review.name: Broke in about 2 months

review.reviewBody: I purchased these shoes and was excited. I put them on and went on the 12.5-mile walk I do daily. When I went to take my shoes off, the quick draw shoelace system that came with the shoe comletely broke. I had to swap them out for the laces completely. I knew eventually I would probably need to replace the quick-release laces that came with the shoes, I just thought for the price, they would last longer than 1 walk or 3 hours. Love the color and styling. Find them a bit snug width-wise.
review.name: The Quick Tie Broke first work out

review.reviewBody: I thought this shoe was very suitable for traveling. I usually wear size 8.5. After receiving the shoe, I felt it was a little small, so I changed to size 9. It is very comfortable to wear, but it is a little narrow in the front, which is not a problem.
review.name: Good design shoes

review.reviewBody: Everyone said that HOKA's were super comfortable, unfortunately that's not my experience. I bought premium shoes hoping they would feel great, however, they give me pain in my arches, too narrow, ( yet I do not have wide feet ) and feel odd under the toes. I was hoping to use them for walking / all around...but I'll need to replace them.
review.name: Not what I expected

review.reviewBody: I ordered the Transport GTX with hope that I could wear it on an upcoming vacation where rain is anticipated. I like the look and feel, but the right foot towbox cover tents down when walking and makes a very annoying snapping noise. I returned the first pair and received a replacement and low and behold, it has the same problem. I have worn HOKA shoes for years and know the size and fit well. I returned the Transport GTX again and will order another shoe model Challenger without Goretex even though it comes in GTX.
review.name: Needs some more design work on the tow box!

review.reviewBody: I've had a pair of transport GTX for over a year. My go to shoe for walking, sometimes hiking. So, I know it's a good product. My newly purchased pair left me puzzled. The left shoe sounded like a flip flop with. every. step! My return was easy, pretty sure the exchanged pair will be fine.
review.name: Great product, bad example

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased a pair of Hoka Transports. I liked them so much that I bought another pair and upgraded to GTX. What a dissapointment. The GTX hurt my feet. I alternate wearing my Transport and my GTX. The Transorts are comfortable. The GTX hurt. I will be testing Hoka's return policy. I can't wear these shoes.
review.name: Hoka GTX Transport is narower than the Hoka Transport

name: Transport GTX Sneaker - Men's

review.reviewBody:
These are the worst tires that I have ever owned.  They just get destroyed in minutes. The composite is way too soft and won't handle any rocks. Bought two, the rear had a tear in the middle of the thread within 2 miles! Front got two punctures within a 10 mile range. 

So if you are planning to ride over rocks, DO NOT get these tires. Go for specialized or Donnelly.
review.name: One RIDE!! They Are Done
comment: The same happens to me is gone in less than  100 miles, should read the comments  before buying rookie mistake

name: Resolute TCS Tubeless Tire

description: Buy the Nikwax Sports Refresh online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Sports Refresh
hasVariant.description: Buy the Nikwax Sports Refresh online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: It works really well! I sometimes use white vinegar when I don't have any Nikawax left. The vinegar works well but this works really well. It's worth it to get the smells out of the clothes I train in a lot.
review.name: This stuff is like magic!

review.reviewBody: The detergent has done exactly what it advertised. Any activewear that I’ve had to clean the detergent has eliminated any odors the clothing had. I would highly recommend this to anyone.
review.name: Product is great

review.reviewBody:
My wife and I have noticed that all dry moisture-wicking materials tend to have a synthetic smell. This smell becomes more pronounced after use and doesn’t wash out with regular detergent.

At first, I thought it was a gimmick and assumed they were infused with perfume to mask odors, but that turned out to be false. I’m not sure how they achieve it, but it works!
review.name: This thing actually works!

review.reviewBody: My clothes didn’t smell sweaty after using these. I hate the workout funk smell.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: I love Nikwax products and this is no exception. It worked great. It made my workout clothes smell refreshed, no lingering smells.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: I tried this product to see if I would like it as much as base wash and base fresh- same high quality as the other products.  Must have for gym clothes and washing my teens athletic clothes.

We’ve tried almost all of the detergents on the market to get rid of the smell in our technical apparel and this is the only one that we’ve found to get the smell out and keep it out. It has a nice fresh, almost minty (but not too strong) smell and we don’t need to use a ton of it, so a bottle lasts us a while.
review.name: Best wash for technical clothing out there!

name: Sports Refresh

review.reviewBody: My fiancé LOVES these pants. He has enough pairs to almost where everyday of the week. They are durable, comfortable, and look nice. Definitely something you can wear on a long hike and they won’t stink. They appear to be built to last for a long time which is also a plus!!

hasVariant.description: Buy the Blackburn Cinch Carbon Fiber Cage online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The description is very accurate.  These are light and stiff.  The BOA is great.  The tongue extends a bit long and stiff which I think will bother me as it is all synthetic and not likely to soften.  They are just a little small for size.  The 42 was too tight in the forward box for my size 9 feet and the 43 was a bit long.  I really wanted these to work.  They feel like great shoes. I had to return them.
review.name: Lightweight with lots of features

review.reviewBody:
This is a good cage, BUT the tolerances are a little off and it is just too tight. 
Also, it was quite expensive and came without screws, which I fully expected. 
When I first placed it on the bike, it looked like it was made for a small water bottle, but a standard bottle fits, with a bit of effort. It is a little tough to get a bottle in and out, and it squeezes the plastic, which will probably contribute to the wear of the bottle itself.
All in all, a nice piece of carbon, but there's really no need to have a bottle this tight.
review.name: Okay...

name: Cinch Carbon Fiber Cage

review.reviewBody: These are the snoawboarding pants I have been searching for my entire life! The high waist is perfect to keep out snow and for a great fit, and the pants are contoured to fit my body. I’m a 6/28 and got the medium, which is slightly large but I’d rather have a little extra movement in the legs than be too tight. The length is long, but I’m short (5’3”), so I’m used to that, and with boots on, I’m sure they won’t even drag. I’m so happy with these pants, I came back to see if more colors are available. I’ll keep an eye out next year for more colors. Thank you for carrying this style!
review.name: All the stars!

review.reviewBody:
These fit very nicely in the waist and hips, (maybe a little big in the waist) but I would need to take off enough length that it would not fit comfortably over my ski boots. I have a smaller waist and larger hips, so to fit my hips the waist was a tad big and the pants were too long.
I sew and do a lot of alterations for myself, but this just doesnt work!

If these came in petite sizes, many of us would love that!
review.name: Flattering but not for a short gal

name: Marcy High Rise Pant - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Kaha 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love these shoes! I have 3 pairs in different styles, my all time favorite is the Tor Ultra Hi for work.
review.name: Great for walking

review.itemreviewed: Kaha 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: The style is great and it looks very nice, but I bought them a size down after buying anothe pair in my hoka regular size which is 8.5, the 8 fitted perfect but I walked with them inside my house for 2 hours and my feet started tu hurt, not to mention my legs. I intended to use these for my trip to Camino de Santiago, I am a hoka transport fan, I have them in almost every color available, they are practically my every day shoe when I travel, I have walked 12-13 miles in a day wth them and haven´t ever felt discomfort, so I was expecting the same or much more from these kaha 2, but I am returnig them because I don´t think I am going to use them after all, I prefer to walk the Camino de Santiago with the hoka transports gtx that I alreeady have and if they are very worn at the end of the trip, I will gladly buy one more pair to replace them because they are so comfortable!!!
review.name: Not for long distances

review.itemreviewed: Kaha 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I really wanted a leather pair of Hoka's for winter! These are great. They feel a little clunki compared to my summer pair but to be expected with leather...more weight! Best shoe for the amount of work (standing on concrete) and walking that I do!!
review.name: Love my Hoka's!!

review.itemreviewed: Kaha 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Initially I only used these shoes for short hikes, and they were ok. After using them for a long hike (9 months after purchasing them) they were very uncomfortable after few hours and caused me terrible blisters. (I am an experienced hiker and I know how to avoid blisters, using the right socks etc..). I wished I could return them even if used or get a discount but the customer service did not give me this option. Very upsetting for such expensive hiking shoes.
review.name: Very uncomfortable for hiking

review.itemreviewed: Kaha 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: The sole was rubbery, more for hiking. I'm retired and only walk in my flat subdivision pavement. I was assuming these were a sole like my other three pairs of Hokas.
review.name: Sole

review.itemreviewed: Kaha 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought these to walk dogs through early morning fields with lots of dew and wanting to keep feet dry. I love them! IMO a bit clunkier than the running HOKAs i have been wearing, but perfectly comfortable for walking. Will take them to Switzerland in a couple of weeks and intend to use for some light hiking
review.name: Great shoe

review.itemreviewed: Kaha 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I loved the color, and they felt good on, but the sole of the shoe is extremely wide on the inside heel area, it sticks out like no shoes I've ever seen and I kept kicking it when I walked so these just weren't going to work for me.
review.name: I returned these

review.itemreviewed: Kaha 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these for walking in the rain - I live in southwest Washington and it rains frequently! These shoes are not as cushioned as my Bondis and I had to re-lace them in order to tighten to keep my heel stable. I haven't gone for a walk in these yet but I'm sure they will work out well for when it rains. I do wish that hola would make a waterproof walking shoe with extra cushioning - my feet would definitely be appreciative.
review.name: Good for rainy walks

review.itemreviewed: Kaha 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Perfect fit and plush insides make going barefoot in these shoes so comfortable
review.name: Pretty and comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Kaha 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I tried them at home before going on the trails, I'm glad I did because 20 minutes later my right foot began to ache.
review.name: I didn't like how these shoes fitted!

name: Kaha 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's

hasVariant.name: Ceramic 2 Pot Set
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Ceramic 2 Pot Set online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Hi I was wondering what the precise messurements of the smaller, 1. 5L pot, are, especially the inner diameter, as I want to nest further equippment inside.

Best Regards
review.name: Question about Mesurement of 1. 5L pot

review.reviewBody: Would be rated higher if a lid was included for the smaller pot & 2 handles - only one is supplied with the kit.
review.name: Needs another lid and handle

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased this MSR 2 pot system and then went on a 2week, 5 state road trip. These posts heat fast and even. These pots are a nice size for car-based/overlanding camping but for 1 to 2 person backpacking they will be too big. The handle is very secure once attached but this lends itself to a problem if you are trying to use both pots to cook. It is difficult to remove and I believe it is unsafe to switch between pots when you have boiling liquid in one. Believe me I tried. Fortunately, I had an old pot grip with me that ended up being my go-to solution. It didn't scratch the cooking surface. I will leave the MSR handle at home next time. The drain holes are a nice gimmick but you have make sure you don't reach across them to remove the lid. You may get scalded by hot steam. (I learned this one quickly). I usually do not cook pasta when camping so this is a useless feature for me. Pearl Couscous is my usual substitution for pasta, and I do not have to drain the water. Overall, these pots are well made and cook well for my needs, but I am disappointed with the handle. I believe the handle is over engineered and too complex to be used safely. Without a backup handle you basically have a one pot system. One more thing. A storage bag would be nice.
review.name: Needs a better handle system

review.reviewBody: Recently used this set to cook for a group of three for a week of skiing in the eastern Sierra. Used with my dragonfly stove to make pasta and sauce, beans and rice, boil water for oatmeal and coffee. Super easy to clean. Only complaint is only having one lid shared between the two pots, but it's easy enough to improvise a second cover for the rare times when you want two
review.name: Easy clean-up group cooking

review.reviewBody:
Absolutely disappointing. Pots are great, but not for outdoor usage. They are too fragile, and I am not talking about inside ceramics. This is obvious that you need to be careful with it. 
Little scratch on outer surface caused, the inside ceramic getting off.
I am huge fan of MSR. Windburner and Huba are my companions on almost every single climb or hike, but for those pots - solid no go.
Be careful if you don't want to be disappointed. This product will not meet your expectations for outdoor usage.I am sorry to say so, but it is far away from the MSR quality and durability we are used to.
review.name: That is not what I expected from MSR quality

review.reviewBody:
Absolutely disappointing. Pots are great, but not for outdoor usage. They are too fragile, and I am not talking about inside ceramics. This is obvious that you need to be careful with it. 
Little scratch on outer surface caused, the inside ceramic getting off.
I am huge fan of MSR. Windburner and Huba are my companions on almost every single climb or hike, but for those pots - solid no go.
Be careful if you don't want to be disappointed. This product will not meet your expectations for outdoor usage (camping, hiking, backpacking). I am sorry to say so, but it is far away from the MSR quality and durability we are used to.
review.name: Not for outdoor usage

review.reviewBody: I've had old msr pots from I don't know when, decided to upgrade to these and could not be happier. Absolutely perfect. Nothing has stuck so far and and these are super easy to clean. Light weight. Could not be happier, great product.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody:
Guten Abend,
wie gestaltet sich die Hitzebeständigkeit der Fusion-Keramik-Beschichtung? Welche Temperaturen hält sie aus?

Vielen Dank,
Mara
review.name: Frage bzgl Hitzebeständigkeit

review.reviewBody: The nesting capability is appreciated and the ceramic pots are nice and nonstick.
review.name: The nesting capability is appreciated

review.reviewBody: This is a great pot kit. I love everything about it. Cooked amazing meals in it. It doesn’t get 5 stars because the rubber handle on the top broke off and now the lid is impossible to work with. Otherwise it’s a great kit. I’m going to see what MSR will do about the lid.
review.name: Awesome backpacking

name: Ceramic 2 Pot Set

review.reviewBody: It's surprisingly warm.  Good collar that doesn't irritate.  A bit larger than I'd thought (5'10" 165lb, Medium) but good if you layer.  Downside to me is a lack of internal pockets.  Thought that because there's no outter chest pocket, there would be one inside.

review.reviewBody: Great Christmas gift. Perfect fit, good quality and lovely colour
review.name: Great Christmas gift. Perfect fit,

review.reviewBody: I don't often write reviews, but Rab items are just excellent and a perfect fit, for me anyway. For someone who is 195cm and slim, finding tops and jackets to fit properly is difficult. Rab's clothing just seems to fit me perfectly. The long arms are a blessing and the fit is always on point. Pus the quality is top draw. This particular item comes up big, so where I usually order a Large, after checking out the measurements, a Medium was just right. If you're looking for a lovely, warm top, this is it.
review.name: Superb as always from Rab

review.reviewBody: Really very warm and comfortable. West it all the time! Would like an inside picket for phone.
review.name: Really very warm and comfortable.

review.reviewBody: Super cute, great quality. Opening is not conducive to sliding one’s foot into. Will have to return.
comment: Thank you for taking the time to write your review. We appreciate you as a Columbia customer and your feedback is what helps us improve. Please reach out if you need further assistance.

review.reviewBody: The opening in these boots is so incredibly small and inflexible that even though I have narrow feet and very slender ankles, I had to take my socks off and push so hard to get my foot into them that it was very painful. Once my feet were in them, I found that they had no support and my ankles sagged inward. Such a disappointment.
review.name: Painfully narrow opening, unsupportive
comment: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us, we will be sure to pass this information to the appropriate teams for future improvement.

review.reviewBody: I have narrow feet and skinny ankles, yet I could barely force my foot through the strangely narrow and inflexible opening. I actually strained my back doing so. Another reviewer had the same problem.
review.name: Incredibly narrow foot opening
comment: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us, we will be sure to pass this information to the appropriate teams for future improvement.

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable slipper style boot made for a variety of adventures! Really appreciate the tread & can't wait to test it out on some ice this winter. Although, I'd recommend sizing up 1/2 a size to make slipping on/off easier on the ankles or to accommodate for a thicker sock; overall very cozy & warm, with a cute style.
review.name: Home, Camp... Anywhere Bootie!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are the cutest and stylish boot ever slip on and off! For fall and winter! Love them! And so warm!!!
review.name: The cutest Boots ever

review.reviewBody: These hikers are supposed to be waterproof. I bought a pair this spring and by August, walking through wet grass, my feet and socks are soaked. The toe of one is delaminating and, as one or more reviewers noted, the laces fall off the tongue because the tongue is not long enough. Also, the spongy, if fashionable laces will not stay tied. I chucked them and bought a pair of old-fashioned, non-spongy ones. They will only stay on the tongue if you reverse thread them through the top islet, and then it is v. close. They are comfortable but certainly not worth the premium price.
review.name: Not as advertised

review.reviewBody: I've used these for years now , I hike in them work in these, mountain bike , everything, since Keens don't fit my feet well.
review.name: This is my third pair , different colors

review.reviewBody: I have difficult feet. I can ware these all day and into the night. They're like slippers. Very happily surprised.
review.name: Honestly, one of the most comfortable shoes.

review.reviewBody: In preparation for a 5 week hiking trip I bought a pair of competitor hiking shoes because my local outfitter didn't have Teva in stock. I tried to break them in and ended up with plantar fasciitis. I returned the competitor shoes and ordered these. I have about 300 miles on them now including 225 from my 5 week trip and they are the most comfortable shoes I have ever worn. I'm ordering another pair not because these need to be replaced, I never want to be in a position of settling for something in stock. This is my 5th pair of Teva's and I'm not risking my feet again to another brand.
review.name: I love Teva shoes

review.reviewBody: Well, this is my second pair, but there was a subtle change from the previous one which I like less. Eyelets for the laces instead of the leather guides. The shoes don't stay tied either (back to the laces and guides I expect), so I have to double knot them, whereas the old ones never had that problem.
review.name: See comments

review.reviewBody: I have been a Teva wearer for many years. I love the quality of their shoes. It's unfortunate that they keep changing their styles as past styles are still much better than the current offering. The other issue I have is that they are extremely overpriced. It's a good quality shoe but they've gotten greedy.
review.name: Great Shoes

review.reviewBody: I AM A LONG TIME TEVA SANDLE WEAR ---BUT--- WORST LACE SYSTEM I HAVE WORN!!! TOUNG IS TOO SHORT--LONGER TOUNG WOULD HELP LACES--- HARD TO SNUG UP LACES-- WONT STAYED TIED --LACES TOO SHORT
review.name: PROBABLY NOT

review.reviewBody: I wear those shoes all the time. they feel great and hold up well. This is my fourth pair!
review.name: I would buy this again...have bought four pair already

review.reviewBody: I used shoes to walk 6 miles each day. One foot/heel sore after each walk. Needs slightly more arch support like the Teva open and closed toe sandals I have used for several years. Not what I was hoping for.
review.name: I would be reluctant to buy again.

review.reviewBody: Disclaimer: I have been a satisfied customer for over a decade and I have never had an issue with a shoe, until now. The spot where the tongue is sewed into the shoe creates a sharp, hard and painful stone-like feature that makes the shoe impossible to wear. After just a few minutes of wearing, I had a serious red spot on both feet. This needs a serious re-design. Do not buy.
review.name: Extremely painful to wear

name: Riva RP Hiking Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I am an 18/20 in most pants. I got these in a 20 and they barely barely fit. They have snap and Velcro closures which pop right open until you get the zipper up. And even then I don’t trust them to stay closed. Belt will be required for fewer surprise openings. 
They are very baggy in the leg until the upper thigh and they get super snug and have a ‘low rise’ feel to them and gather in an unflattering way (aka camel toe). And somehow despite barely getting them to snap shut, when I sit, they have a huge gap right on my butt crack. Like a scoop just waiting to get filled with snow. Who wants that skiing? Honestly? I prefer my backside to be fully covered when I ski, just saying. 
I appreciate that I was able to try something on for a change - functional plus size gear is hard to find. But it would be nice if companies understood how to make a plus size gear that actually fits, instead of just sizing up so they can say they carry extended sizes (ie: plus sizes need more coverage in back please!)
If I didn’t need -something- I’d return them. But they are the best I could find in my price range so I’m going to have to settle… again. I will need a belt and good long underwear to compensate for the lousy coverage on the backside. Can’t wait to find something I like that actually fits.
review.name: Not a good plus size cut

name: Bliss Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody:
Super easy to adjust size to fit with or without a hat, which is really nice for touring.  The lack of ear flaps makes it pack down nice for carrying it on your pack for the uphill.  The only thing I didn't like it it could use just a little bit more padding on the top of the head, but wearing even a super thin hat gets rid of the issue.  

It was a great helmet for 2 uses, then my dog plucked it off the gear shelf and ate it.  I liked it enough that I bought a replacement.

For sizing comparison, the 59-63cm fits me similar to my Smith extra large helmet.
review.name: tasty treat

description: Buy the POC Synovia VPD Short - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Synovia VPD Short - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the POC Synovia VPD Short - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Wanted some extra protection for downhill mtb, having the extra side padding plus tailbone makes me feel more comfortable, and even though I ride downhill the chamois makes it more comfortable riding around, and adds some protection if you fall and connect with the frame... Very comfortable, chamois took a ride to get used to then I appreciated it. Fits true to size.
review.name: Great fit, comfortable, not too hot

review.reviewBody: I always wear SixSixOne Evo Compression Short w/ Chamois when I ride an mtb, and they have saved my hips and thighs in crashes in Phoenix, Sedona, Moab, and Park City.   They are great protection shorts and they have a great chamois, but I wanted to try something different.  The pictures for the POC Synovia VPD Short do not show the chamois, so I thought I would post a review after I bought a pair.  The POC Synovia VPD Short has a thick, green colored chamois comparable in quality to the chamois in my Giordana FR-C Pro bib shorts.  I was very happy to see a quality chamois in the POC Synovia VPD Short rather than, say, the thin, do nothing chamois found in Troy Lee Designs liner shorts.  The POC chamois felt comfortable on the first ride.  The sizing seems a little smaller than the size chart.  I typically wear a size XL with my 37 inch waist, and the size chart says the XL is 39 inches and the L is 36.6 inches.  I bought both an L and an XL, expecting the XL to be too big, but the XL fits snugly, like spandex shorts should.   I'm happy with the size XL.
review.name: Good chamois

name: Synovia VPD Short - Men's

description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear PCT 65L Backpack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: PCT 65L Backpack - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear PCT 65L Backpack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Love this backpack! So many compartments to keep all my things organized. Yet lightweight and comfortable.
review.name: Awesome Backpack

review.reviewBody: It's an ergonomic backpack, and I feel completely comfortable using it during hikes. The only issue, in my opinion, is that the bottom is a bit narrow.
review.name: recommended

review.reviewBody: This backpack is both lightweight and durable. It has the space needed for an extended trip and tightens down for a shorter journey. The body size adjustments make for a great and comfortable fit. No complaints!
review.name: Very comfortable and spacious pack all around

review.reviewBody: I'm a 6', 165 lbs dude and have this pack and it works great. I never run out of room with this pack. Light pink and deep purple is manly. Everything super functional and well made. Absolutely zero complaints.
review.name: Hella Nice

review.reviewBody: I took this out on it's first climbing trip on Mount Shuksan this past weekend. While I absolutely love the generous pockets and webbing... I had some serious issues with the shoulder straps. About a mile in I needed to adjust them because the internal frame was poking into my hips (I am about a size 12 for reference). After this, the velcro kept coming undone every time I would put the heavy pack on my shoulders. I don't know if there was something I was missing to secure the straps more rather than just velco, but it caused a high level of neck pain with the way the velco straps kept coming completely undone and the torso ratio be off and I had to keep stopping to adjust like every 5 minutes.
review.name: shuksansads

review.reviewBody:
-Really like the way you can access the central part of the pack without undoing the brain. That design is magnificent. 
-The front pouch is VERY generous and I greatly appreciate that. I can put my helmet and crampons and gaiters in there at the same time. Kind of amazing compared to not having any way to secure my helmet before, so I am really delighted by that. 
-There is also a ton of strapping/webbing on the outside of the pack to secure gear which is very appreciated. 
-Love the two zipper pouches on the brain. 
-Easy enough to adjust the height of the shoulder straps
-very roomy side pockets for water bottle, sun screen, etc. Really like the way you can stick the water bottle in side ways to grab easier while the pack is on.

Cons:
-The color is not great- I feel like outdoor companies think all women in the outdoors want is pastel colors and that's simply not true. 
-I would say it's a little bit of a tight squeeze to get my sleeping back (in a compression sack) into the bottom portion. 
-Also wish there was another zipper for the bottom.
- A little worried the velcro to adjust the shoulder strap height might fail at some point due to wear and tear.
review.name: delighted and some possible improvements

review.reviewBody:
The Mountain Hardwear PCT 65L Pack made it difficult to pack for our most recent trips, but in the absolute best way possible! There is so much storage I wanted to take a lot of extra items I don't normally take backpacking because I had the room! 

My two favorite parts of the PCT 65L pack are the external side pockets and the storage on the top of the pack. In the external side pockets I was able to fit my Helinox camp chair on one side and on the other a Nalgene along with some down bootie slippers (since the mountains are starting to feel like fall now!). The top of the pack also has amazing storage with great accessibility. There are three zippers with separate compartments. They all were easily accessible while the pack was on, my partner had no issue grabbing the map out of one of the pockets while we were hiking. 

My last pack was a size small and the PCT 65L I have is a M/L. With all the padded, adjustable shoulder and waist straps I was easily able to make this pack fit me properly and comfortably. I've taken this pack on a few weekend trips now and I have no complaints. Overall, I would give this an A+ pack!
review.name: Storage on storage!

name: PCT 65L Backpack - Women's

review.reviewBody: Great boots, nice and stiff but comfy.
review.name: Super Comfy

review.reviewBody: These are great entry level boots. Solid for the beginner/ beginnermediate nordic skier.  The boots break in well and did not cause me any hot spots or soreness.  As you break the boots in you will be able to get the laces tighter each time you wear them. The boots are warm and cozy on my feet.  I also wear a thicker more classic/ old school style wool ski sock when nordic skiing versus downhill skiing. The only issue I found was that they are a bit voluminous, a small shim under the foot bed fixed this volume issue.  Length-wise I found them to be true to size.
review.name: Solid Boots, Great entry level BC boot.

review.reviewBody: To be fair, this is my first pair of back country boots.  I normally make my laces pretty snug. After a few uses (short ski trips 30 -60 min) started to really hurt at the base of my toes where they fold across the top of my foot. I almost returned them. Tried loosening the laces a lot in that area, and that helped quite a bit.  I will probably wear tape across my foot for longer trips. Hopefully they will break in and I won't need the tape forever!
review.name: Supportive boots, difficult break-in
comment: I second Lisa. They pinch the forefoot. I also find them to be cold. Spend more and go with a better boot.

name: BCX Tour Ski Boot - 2025

I kept them anyway because they are so cute and I think I’ll be tolerate it.
review.name: So cute! Size down?

review.reviewBody: I purchased a pair of Sorel women's wedge sandals, and they were very comfortable. Curious about their comfort level, I also decided to try a pair of loafers. While I've tried other brands, but these loafers felt the most comfortable to me. I highly recommend them to my colleagues at work!
review.name: Comfortable!

review.reviewBody: I was disappointed, I currently own 11 pairs of Sorel shoes. I hadn’t paid close attention to the materials. 100% synthetic. They felt and looked like cheap knockoffs. I immediately returned them. I continue to wait for my credit.
review.name: Quality
comment: Hello Cynthia, we want to extend our apologies concerning your experience. We pride ourselves in maintaining the highest quality standards for our customers and apologize we missed the mark here.

review.reviewBody: I love the look but very stiff and not a lot of cushion in the sole unlike other brands.  Disappointing in light of the high quality of the other products that I have purchased and worn for years.
review.name: Nice style, lacking in comfort
comment: Hello Danielle, we appreciate you sharing your feedback and we're sorry JOAN NOW™ City Women's Loafer didn't meet your standards. We will inform our product team of your concerns and ensure this is fixed for the future.

review.reviewBody: Love the lover in black.  I got brown last year and the black was sold out when I went to order weeks later.  I notice the leather is not as soft and the ball portion is not padded as much as last year.  I stand 8 to 9 hours a day working in retail and your product has been a lifesaver.  But I did notice a change in comfort in his shoe.
review.name: Black lofer

review.reviewBody: J’ai acheté au moins + 7 paires de souliers et bottes Sorel et je suis toujours satisfaite de vos produits de très grande qualités ! Merci 😍

name: Joan Now City Loafer - Women's

hasVariant.name: Bike Pant - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Ripton Bike Pant - Women's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I'm 5'3 and about 135, and based on reviews I went with the small. I'm a small in Dharco & TLD shorts, and these were TINY in the waist. I love the fit, and the length, and I'm assuming theyd be super comfortable but I could barely get them buttoned. Exchanging for a Medium and hoping they work because they're awesome. For reference also, I wear a 27 in the Ripton Hiking Jean and they're a bit loose but perfect.
review.name: So comfortable, but size up

review.reviewBody: I haven't wore these for mountain biking yet, my intended purpose, but I wore them on the motorcycle and hiking and I love them! I always have trouble getting pants that fit, these do. I just ordered another pair in black.
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: I got these to use during warmer weather, but still have the protection of a pant. They are lightweight but durable and really comfortable. I am 5'1" and they fit just slightly long on me so I could see them being short on a tall girl. They do run large, I measured my waist and I was technically a medium on their size chart but ordered a small. The smalls are snug on my waist but baggy everywhere else especially after pedaling. I don't like the super skinny fit so I am happy they are relaxed fit in the legs. I am normally a size 28 in jeans and the smalls in these fit well.
review.name: A great summer pant!

review.reviewBody:
This is my first pair of pants from Ripton and let me say you should just BUY THEM! So comfy, great to pedal in and I dont feel like a goober walking around in them after. 

I am a size medium, (5'6, about 140lbs) with some booty, and I am so happy how good it is in my waist and my legs arent squished. Highly recomment!
review.name: LOVE

name: Bike Pant - Women's
