description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Lamina Eco AF Sleeping Bag: 15F Synthetic online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Lamina Eco AF Sleeping Bag: 15F Synthetic
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Lamina Eco AF Sleeping Bag: 15F Synthetic online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Lamina Eco AF Sleeping Bag: 15F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: So far, I'm really enjoying this sleeping bag. Warm, packable, lightweight for a synthetic bag, and eco friendly too! It's definitely a little bit bulkier and heavier than my old Big Agnes skeeter SL 20 (down), but it still subs into my regular pack without an issue! I'm interested to see how the white holds up, but I'm not too worried about some dirt showing as it gets more use. I'm about 6'1" and I went with the regular size, and the fit is nice with some room in the foot box. The compression sack that it came with ripped down one of the seams my first time using it, but otherwise everything has worked great so far!
review.name: Good sleeping bag, excited to use more.

review.itemreviewed: Lamina Eco AF Sleeping Bag: 15F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: I so, so wanted to love this bag, and I really do appreciate Mountain Hardwear upping the game of synthetic sleeping bags.  And I will say, the bad itself is comfy!  However, it’s definitely well over 3 lbs (and I bought the petite) and takes quite a bit of effort to stuff in my backpack.
review.name: Almost there

review.itemreviewed: Lamina Eco AF Sleeping Bag: 15F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: The quality of this bag is excellent, as is the zipper, etc. and love the idea of an ECO friendly bag, problem is it is brutally tight in the shoulders. I am not huge at 5'-8" and 22" chest, but I cannot even zip this up. Maybe a fluke from the manufacturer. So it went to my 10 year old, she loves it.
review.name: I really wanted to love this bag, but...

review.itemreviewed: Lamina Eco AF Sleeping Bag: 15F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: Simply Amazing, get one! I needed a failsafe synthetic cold weather bag for mixed conditions and landed on the 15 degree Lamina Eco. Its soft and supple, incredibly comfortable, the color reminds me of luxury hotel bedding which gets your mind right for how you will sleep. Pleasantly surprised by how small it stuffed on a recent trip, only took about half the volume of my handlebar bag. . Never felt damp or clammy even when my clothes were damp, warm and comfortable down to 30 degrees on a recent trip.
review.name: Bikepackers dream!!

review.itemreviewed: Lamina Eco AF Sleeping Bag: 15F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: Its way warm, and packs down pretty small. What more can you really ask for? I definitely recommend the lamina to everyone looking for a good three season bag.
review.name: Super Awesome Bag

review.itemreviewed: Lamina Eco AF Sleeping Bag: 15F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: After several trips this bag has proven to be the best bag we have owned.  Light weight, 2.5 pounds is pretty light for a 15 degree bag.  Compresses much smaller than expected giving you extra room in your pack.  The white is easy to keep white so far.  So warm but no hot spots or cold spots.  Zipper could be easier to pull but its not bad and it does not hang up on the surrounding fabric.   Worth $279.00, we bought three and we all love them.  Its a pretty perfect bag.
review.name: Best value ever

review.itemreviewed: Lamina Eco AF Sleeping Bag: 15F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: Honestly could not be happier with this purchase. I have used it on 2 shorter backpacking trips now (2 and 3 nights) and I love it. It packs down incredibly well, regardless of it being a synthetic bag, and its a good weight for a 15 degree bag in this price range. My buddy on one of the trips had the mountain hardware rook 15 degree down bag and this one was just about the same size when packed down. We also got rained on one night when a storm came in unexpectedly and our rain fly was off, so I was incredibly happy to have a synthetic bag as everything in the tent got soaked. And even when both me and the bag were wet I still stayed plenty warm! I saw some reviews saying the bag is too tight, but even being a big guy I haven't had issues with it. Its a mummy bag so it is a little tight, but honestly it just feels like I'm being swaddled when I sleep which is amazing. The material is incredibly soft and comfortable as well. On top of all the amazing things about this bag, its also ~more~ eco friendly, which was a HUGE selling point for me! No matter how sustainable the down is sourced, synthetic is still going to be better. The recycled material is good for peace of mind, and the fact that they didn't dye it is awesome! Also I love the white. Even though it will certainly get dirty, each stain will carry a memory which I like. I 100% recommend this bag.
review.name: Amazing Synthetic Bag

review.itemreviewed: Lamina Eco AF Sleeping Bag: 15F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: We purchased 3 of these a month ago, two large and one regular.  We tried them out last weekend when we had the cold snap here in the Northern Arizona Mountains at 7,000 feet plus.  It was 37 degrees, far from the rated 15 but a test none the less.  In a single wall tent on a r2.1 pad, we were all extremely comfortable.  No sweating from being too warm, no sense of cold.  The second night we left the tent flaps open just to see if it mattered.  It didn't.  we were safe and warm with the draw string somewhat  taught inside our beautiful new Lamina 15 eco's.  Only warning, they are snug in the shoulders but not too tight, 46" chest doesn't fit everything, if you are bigger than this, size up.  The foot box is roomy and stays at a perfect constant temp.  The entire bag stays warn.
review.name: Best lightweight bag on the market

review.itemreviewed: Lamina Eco AF Sleeping Bag: 15F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: It’s a great bag for sure! My only complaint is that I’m a bigger guy at 6’1” 240lbs and it is definitely snug around my chest/shoulders. I ordered the biggest one available.
review.name: A little snug for the XL people.

name: Lamina Eco AF Sleeping Bag: 15F Synthetic

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 Invisible GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: First of all, the shoe runs small compared to Sense Ride 4. More importantly it seems that this model is forcing my foot into pronation and it feels like I'm only running on the outside edge of my foot. Very uncomfortable! I feel none of that on my Sense Ride 4. This shoe makes me feel clumsy and unsure of my strides downhill. Sad, I loved sense ride 4, but this is a no go.
review.name: Sizes are too small, very unfomfortable
comment:
Hi Samo! 
Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. 
We often make adjustments to our products based on direct customer feedback. We 
will be sure to pass on your feedback to the relevant department. 
We are sorry for any inconvenience caused

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 Invisible GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: More comfortable after a few break-in walks, I like the warmth of gore-tex being up north, my quicklace was a little lopsided (when pulling). Not sure what to do about that other than being careful. Coming from the Outline and Outpulse, not as stable, so now I know I need a hiking model too.
review.name: Comfortable, gore-tex adds warmth

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 Invisible GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Ces souliers sont très durables, je suis agréablement surpris!!
review.name: Durable

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 Invisible GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: In my experience, Salomon is one of the few brands that still prioritizes exceptional craftsmanship in their shoes. I'm a huge fan of their products. I currently own the Sense Ride 5 without Gore-Tex and now have these as well, and I must say the quality is outstanding. The durability and comfort of these shoes are unparalleled. I would recommend considering sizing up, but of course, that can vary depending on individual preferences and foot shape. Overall, I highly recommend these shoes to anyone looking for top-notch quality and performance.
review.name: Amazing quality

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 Invisible GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Beautiful shoe great design well constructed but why not true to size?
review.name: I wish this would have been the perfect shoe
comment: Hello, I appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We constantly work to get better! Please keep in mind that your suggestions are being taken into consideration!

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 Invisible GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Yes - the performance is well documented in the advert but for a guy (me) that’s has no fashion sense it’s a great way to show that I might have some. Personally the rocker style I believe has helped me on long trail runs with the spring in my step but it for sure helps having them on at the end of the run cause to me my feet still felt good. And trust me - the Gore-Tex only adds to this great ride because of course it keeps you dry and warm.
review.name: Love these Hikers!!!!

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 Invisible GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I really like these Sense Ride 5 Gore-Tex trail running shoes. I use them on wetter days for taking the dog up the trails and my feet are super happy. I purchased these in the Gore-Tex and non-Gore-Tex versions and am happy I did. They are supportive and comfortable and the tread is amazing. 

I think you will like them a lot too!
review.name: Yes!!

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 Invisible GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I bought these because Solomon has a good reputation and I wanted to replace my Merrels. I wear 10.5 normally so I bought them in 10.5. When I got them they were a little snug but it wasn’t too uncomfortable so I didn’t think much of it. Yesterday was my first time being physically active while wearing them and I was extremely uncomfortable to the point where the big toe on my right foot was swollen when I took them off. 
I also cannot stand the lacing system on these shoes. It is 100% inferior to traditional laces. 

If you’re going to buy these shoes, go up half a size.
review.name: Runs small
comment: Hi, thank you for sharing your experience with us. We always strive to improve! Your feedback has been helpful for us!

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 Invisible GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I have two pairs of these, gore-tex and non-gore-tex. 

Today it rained and I finally took these gore-tex versions out of the box. When I first received these, I was concerned because they were slightly tighter than the non-gore-tex version when trying the two versions on. Having a medium wide foot, some shoes can be a bit uncomfortable over time. Luckily, taking the chance paid off for me. On my early morning walk with the dog, well over an hour and many steps, they became more and more comfortable as the walk went on. My feet stayed dry and happy all day, even after I used them for two additional walks in the rain. I like them I hope others will enjoy them as much as I do already. 

I have many Salomon products and I'm super happy with all of them.
review.name: Another great shoe

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 Invisible GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Value to me is a company that offers quality products (even the hard to get expensive lines) from time to time at PRICES that me and my budget friendly friends can afford or at least willing to spend money on when quality like this is offered. I have had these and last years speedcross 6 for months now and MY value is in the comfort and quality that still there. Bravo to a company that knows its customers and has affordable products from time to time and yes had a great carbon footprint!  Keep it up Salomon
review.name: True to life

name: Sense Ride 5 Invisible GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's

description: Buy the Dometic CFX3 55IM Powered Cooler + Ice Maker online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: CFX3 55IM Powered Cooler + Ice Maker
hasVariant.description: Buy the Dometic CFX3 55IM Powered Cooler + Ice Maker online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Rattles on today's bumpy roads, slow to cool, and VERY poorly insulated resulting in additional power drain.  Doubt it will last a day past warranty and no doubt coverage will be denied based on the rattle.
review.name: Not worth the money.
comment:
Hi,

Thank you for reaching out, and we are very sorry about your experience. 
If you experience anything unusual or something that might imply an error and if you bought this product on our website, you have 2 years of warranty, so I suggest you to fill out our warranty form: https://www.dometic.com/en-us/support/warranty 

If you bought it from a dealer, I would suggest you to get in contact with them about your warranty options. 

However if you did not buy this on our website you are more then welcome, to visit one of our service providers. You can find them here: https://www.dometic.com/en-us/support/service-locator

Kind regards,
Eszter
Dometic Sales Support

review.reviewBody: This has been the best investment in equipment as we have been making multiple cross country road trips in our van. No more buying of ice cubes that melt and soak my food. In particular, I appreciate that it automatically turns off, so it will never drain my car battery. Perfect size for our 2-person needs. For one person I could do with a size smaller. I have had it for several years, it is still going strong and I have proudly shown it to many people.
review.name: The Best

review.reviewBody: We love this cooler.  Love the capability to make ice when we are out wheelin’. Wish the top of the cover was made better but overall it’s a great cooler.
review.name: Love the design…

review.reviewBody: Worked great for a year and a half then developed a pin hole in the compressor and leaked oil.  Realized where the oil was coming from just as 2 year warranty expired.  Could not be fixed.  Was used for tailgating and backyard parties.  Would not buy again and will find a more rugged solution.
review.name: CFX50W

review.reviewBody: Have had this unit for about a year and am thankful that I havent had any compressor failures or anything of that sort. For the most part it functions as intended HOWEVER, the compressor makes a clunking/rattling noise if you drive over rough road or railroad tracks, or things of that nature. This is really annoying when you have the unit inside of an SUV that is essentially daily driven.  There is no reason for this and the CFX3 SLD55 unit to make as much noise as they do. It should ride silently regardless of it being inside an SUV or mounted in the bed of a truck. The cfx3 app is also god awful. It doesn't work half the time whether your on bluetooth or connected via wifi. This app needs a substantial overhaul.
review.name: Pros and Cons with this one.

review.reviewBody:
This is the 2nd CFX unit I purchased, the first one was dead on arrival (warning 33). I submitted a case to Dometic on a Sunday explaining that I was planning to leave on a camping trip Friday. The next day I had a pre-paid return label and my replacement was on it’s way. The replacement arrived just in time!

We purchased this unit because our Rough Country 45L was too small. This unit, while bigger and more feature rich is not a great ‘value’ when you compare price per L of cold storage. Time will tell where durability comes into play.
review.name: Working well, good service, but..

review.reviewBody: We have use the 55 on our trip to the Baja and several camping trips and we are very happy with this cooler, frig and as a freezer.  It is so amazing not to be messing with ice and water.  It works great, love the Bluetooth app to my phone.  Great product and company to work with.  I love it.
review.name: Dometic CFX3 55IM

review.reviewBody: This is my third 12V fridge. I have the least use with this CFX355IM but am already pleased. I run the fridges off a portable battery box. While driving, the battery is charged via an inverter and I switch to a 100w solar panel once parked. I am seeing average power consumption at around 11.5 watts per hour with this CFX355IM at 70 degree outside temps and a 36 degree fridge setting. I can run 7 days without charging the battery but with the solar and a small amount of driving, the battery box stays fully charged. No drain from the vehicle battery and cold food all week!
review.name: Awesome 12V fridge

review.reviewBody: This thing is quiet, efficient and reliable. I use it along with a Dometic PLB40 battery and an Overland Solar Bugout 130 solar charger. My biggest gripe with Dometic was they were not at all helpful in guiding me to a compatible solar panel for the plb40, so since I have tested this cooler along with the additional items, I wanted to let others know the three make an AWESOME combination!
review.name: Exceeded my expectations

review.reviewBody: I got this for a week long camping trip for some dispersed camping in Northwest South Dakota on federal lands open to dispersed camping. The fridge stood up to 60+ miles of offroading on sketchy USFS roads both in the bed of the truck and in the cab. It's whisper quiet and not only stays cold bet gets cold crazy fast. I was initially worried about being able to fit enough food for a week in this size but without needing ice you can easily fit enough food for a few people for a week with room to spare.
review.name: Game changer

name: CFX3 55IM Powered Cooler + Ice Maker

review.itemreviewed: Talus AT UltraDry Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have a slightly older model of these but i can honestly say I’ve never had a better boot. Ive had my pair for over 4 years putting untold miles on them doing trail work in Vermont, walking on slippery logs and rocks creeks in the woods for a whole season, and hiking often as well. These boots stick where you put them and keep you there. Excellent ankle and arch support which doesn’t feel constrictive. Breathable and pretty darn water resistant. Oh and they are still going and look like they have years to go. These shoes really help me do my job, I cannot recommend them enough.
review.name: Ultimate hiking boot for field tech work
comment: We are happy to hear that our Talus line has been providing you with reliable comfort, support, and durability over the years! Thank you for the wonderful review. Happy hiking!

review.itemreviewed: Talus AT UltraDry Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Wore these for a 30-mile backcountry trip in Ireland. Despite not breaking them in, they were extremely comfortable and stayed completely dry the entire trek! We hiked through rain and mud and my partner’s boots soaked through but my socks and feet remained dry. I have wide feet and typically wear a 7.5-8…bought the 8 wide and they were perfect. I like the look of them too!
review.name: Comfy and dry

review.itemreviewed: Talus AT UltraDry Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Replaced an older pair. No break-in period. Waterproof and breathable. Good in winter and summer.
review.name: Vasque 7385
comment: We are glad to hear that your new pair required no break in process! Thank you for leaving us this review and for supporting our brand!

review.itemreviewed: Talus AT UltraDry Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: We purchase these vasque boots years ago, but had not used them until recently. After walking 10 miles up an incline totally 250 feet, the soles fell off both boots.
review.name: Sole fell off hiking 10 mi; older barely used.
comment: Hi, I am sorry to hear about the soles falling off. I have sent you an email and will help you out to the best of my ability to get you back out hiking.

review.itemreviewed: Talus AT UltraDry Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Wet feet on many hiking trips! They are not impermeable; I'm quite disappointed
review.name: Faultly impermeability
comment: We are sorry to hear the waterproofing on your talus boots is not performing as expected. These are covered under a one year warranty. We ask that you please return to the retailer for warranty coverage or contact us directly at 1-800-224-4453 for further assistance.

review.itemreviewed: Talus AT UltraDry Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I tried to get a new pair of Vasque hikers since they have been my LIFE for the past 12 years.  I had my friend convinced they are the best, and she almost bought them, but then I tried it on too... I felt like they erased any ergonomics or quality from these shoes, I should just wear a plastic milk jug on my feet. I could not imagine trusting them ever again on a trail. I almost cried right there in the store. I have to move on to another brand after that experience.
review.name: Vasque gave up on quality.

review.itemreviewed: Talus AT UltraDry Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these as my first pair of hiking boots around 6 months ago and I absolutely love them. They are super comfortable on longer hikes and don't feel too heavy. I did get blisters the first time I wore them on a 5 mile hike, but once they heeled they've never given me a problem again. Another random thing that doesn't bother me too much, but if you're hiking in dirt or mud, it will seep through the mesh in the back and stain your socks. Other than that, no major signs of wear and tear even though I've hiked around 15 miles a week in them for months.
review.name: Amazing Hiking Boots

name: Talus AT UltraDry Wide Hiking Boot - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Alp Mate Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: They are my third pair of Salewa hiking boots and will continue to be my go to hiking shoe\boot. I have narrow feet and the fit is pretty much right on. I did have my little toes rub but that issue seems to have work it's way out. Also this boots lacing system doesn't tighten as well as past boots. Though not a big issue with me.
review.name: Easy Break In

review.itemreviewed: Alp Mate Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great on all surfaces
review.name: Allrouder

review.itemreviewed: Alp Mate Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: accurate sizing and superb comfort and protection. It does not get any better!
review.name: The Boot

review.itemreviewed: Alp Mate Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Sturdy, reliable, comfortable and looks good!
review.name: great boots!!

review.itemreviewed: Alp Mate Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
The shoe particularly the right shoe 
It took forever to break in and even then it still is not comfortable 
I have spoken with two other people who have the same shoes 
They did not have a bad experience 
So maybe the right shoe was a mishap
review.name: Not really happy with this shoe

review.itemreviewed: Alp Mate Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: This s is my third pair of Salewa boots. My first pair lasted 7 seasons.  I own a pair of their winter boots, which I really like and so far these are great. They're not using vibram soles anymore so I suppose I'll need to see how well the soles wear.
review.name: Salewa boots fit my feet.

review.itemreviewed: Alp Mate Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought this as a sure-footed boot that would serve me as I guide people through Fairbanks, Alaska in the dead of winter.  I have heavier, more insulated boots when the temperatures drop colder than -10, but until then... these are amazing.  I don't slip, my feet stay warm, the traction is amazing, and they are comfortable to be on my feet 12-14 hours a day!  Great boot.
review.name: Excellent cross-over boot

review.itemreviewed: Alp Mate Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are my first pair of salewa boots. This particular pair I would not recommend. I like my boots tight and these are hard to get tight. The bottom eye string rubs against my pinky toe and almost gives a blister. I can’t wear them 2 days in a row
review.name: Wouldn’t recommend this boot

review.itemreviewed: Alp Mate Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Comfortable and well built and great looking.
review.name: Nicely constructed

review.itemreviewed: Alp Mate Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These Salewa boots felt like they were broke in right out of the box.  They are extremely comfortable, and great for not just walking trails but also very purposeful as a general everyday boot.  I wear mine at work on the shooting range, and they have have held up great.  I plan on purchasing another pair to supplement or rotate out with this current pair.  My feet are fairly wide, so I went at least a half size up to compensate.
review.name: Great boots out of the box

name: Alp Mate Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's

description: Buy the Oboz Sawtooth X Mid Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Sawtooth X Mid Boot - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Oboz Sawtooth X Mid Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I haven't worn these yet, but since they are identical (except for color) to my previous ones I know I'll be happy with them. They are very comfortable & they make my feet feel stable. I wear a medium, but I lean towards narrow. I like a shoe that is a bit roomy, esp. in the toe box area. I had foot surgery last fall & once I started wearing my Oboz again they felt even better than before my surgery! I've had people approach me about what shoes I was wearing! They liked the looks of them.
review.name: Comfortable, good looking shoes

review.reviewBody: These shoes check all the boxes for me. Great ankle and arch support for long treks. Also I love how lightweight they are. I have narrow heels and these hug my achilles and don’t rub or slip.
review.name: My Favorite Hiking Shoe

review.reviewBody: Who doesn't love a lightweight leather mid boot?! These boots have great traction on all terrain! I usually have issues with my feet bumping into the toe box on big descents and I do not have this issue with this boot! Very sturdy and my feet feel great inside the shoe! Will definitely be holding onto this boot!
review.name: Love This Boot!!!

name: Sawtooth X Mid Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: I accidentally reviewed this hoodie under the cheaper one for 148. Both have the same problem, snag easy and will come apart and unravel within a few wears. I would upload a picture but it doesn't look like that is an option. Both of these were gifts from my wife and we are very disappointed considering the amount of money we have spent with this company. I would expect this from a big box store purchase but not from a company like Faherty. I will stick to Carbon 2 Cobalt when I want something unique or west coast.

hasVariant.name: Access 1 Tent: 1-Person 4-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Access 1 Tent: 1-Person 4-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I was setting the tent up for the first time in my living room before taking it to Patagonia. Glad I decided to set it up before I took it because one pole broke straight out of the bag. I liked the idea of this tent for its double-wall design and light weight, but what good is a tent when you can't trust the poles?!? I've returned it.
review.name: Pole broke

review.reviewBody: Would be nice if body of tent had tie outs in the middle of tent to expand/ tighten floor space. A few more inches across would have helped instead of 30” 35 would have been much better. For a few more ounces would be worth it. Frankly seperate poles would be lighter than the hub design most companies use now, and less likely to to have issues. 70 year old gear head.
review.name: Suggestions

review.reviewBody: I recently bought this tent and took it out for 2 nights on a coastal hike. Each morning my sleeping bag was soaked from condensation dripping off the inner tent ceiling onto my bag. The 2nd night I had the inner tent door unzipped at the top even but it didn't change anything. Not a drop of rain either night but was humid each morning. There is only 1 small 'vent' in the inner tent. I can't imagine using this tent in a humid climate (Pacific Northwest in my case) and my sleeping bag staying dry. Very disappointed in MSR since they are a PNW based company & to design a tent with such poor ventilation seems odd. The tent is solid & I believe it would hold up in high winds, snow & rain but I suspect my sleeping bag would be wet regardless. This tent needs 3 more 'vents" & it would probably be the best solo tent money could buy. I would not recommend this tent, especially not for the price.
review.name: Poor ventilation. Otherwise great.

review.reviewBody: For me, the most intuitive tent wins. I want the tent up and ready in 1 minute at the end of the day, especially when the weather is bad. I tested this tent out on Mt. Hood, the North Cascades, and a whole summer in Rifle Canyon. It saw wind, rain, hail, and a thunderstorm. I had the tent set up with numb fingers. It passes the test on every occasion!
review.name: Intuitive!

review.reviewBody:
When it comes to 4-season tents you have a choice of 9lb+ porta-caves (e.g. the Trango) or 3-4lb treeline tents such as the MSR Access that will support a foot or two of snow and withstand serious wind. The Access makes good compromises to keep the weight respectable without "stupid light" choices such as mesh body or 10D fabrics (yes, I am talking about the Slingfin Portal). It is reasonably easy to set up, can be pitched fly first without contortions with the optional footprint, uses robust fabrics, and has copious guy points. But it is far from perfect.

Unlike the Hubba NX1, which seems targeted at hobbits with its 36 inch peak height, the Access 1 is 40 inches tall. However, it insists on maintaining the unreasonably short 84 inch inner. If you are 6 ft or over your head and feet will touch the inner walls, and the unavoidable condensation there will get your sleeping bag damp. Not sure why MSR does this, it makes no sense other than to allow them to use universal footprints. This is a particularly significant oversight for this type of tent, where warmer days allowing to dry out your sleeping bag may be limited.

The door on the inner narrows where the torso typically enters and exits. The placement of the seams dictates this choice, and despite that ingress and egress is fairly straightforward ever for someone like me who is not very flexible.

There are only two pockets - one at the foot and one at the head. The absence of side pockets in the head and ceiling areas is inexplicable, and frankly inexcusable.

Have not yet used it in humid conditions, but the ventilation of the inner is provided by a single small triangular window. In addition to limited ventilation it cannot be covered with a solid panel. Would have loved to see two windows with solid covers.

Great that MSR has started using wide mouth stuff sacks, but making that from 30D fabric added a few unnecessary ounces to the packed weight. That is one area where a lighter fabric would have been justified.

The poles collapse to a fairly significant length. They don't fall together even, with 1-2 sections sticking out both on top and the bottom and adding 2-3 inches on either side to the pole sack length. This makes the pole sack too long to be stored in a horizontal position in the pack.

I am sure MSR has tested this, but bending the Syclone poles is a nerve wracking experience - the plasticky feel makes me think that they will snap at any time. There is no pole sleeve provided - not sure if this means that MSR thinks the poles will never break, or that a sleeve will not be effective if they do.
review.name: Best treeline tent.. but with meaningful warts

review.reviewBody:
Went on a 6 night back pack hunting trip at 6500ft in the beartooth wilderness area of montana in september so I was expecting snow / wind and thats why I wanted to try a 4 season tent. I chose the access 1 because of the weight and price. My first day it was windy, 30 mph winds all day, I didnt use all the steaks, just the 4 corners and 1 for the rain cover and it held up just fine. The next 2 days it snowed all day, heavy wet snow, it took out my bear fence actually. The tent kept me dry and warm, I had some(very little) condensation on the roof but that is to be expected from a tent, but compared to the tents i tried in the past this one did great, last year i had to leave early because it snowed and i woke up all wet and tons of condensation on the roof. 
For the size of the tent, It was nice being able to sit up all the way and wide enough to sleep comfortably (I am 6'4" and I had a couple inches to spare if your 6'6" it would be tight, no complaints for me though). 
I like the rain cover how theirs enough room to keep your boots, pack and bow dry but not inside the tent.
Overall I noticed the tent kept in heat and stayed dry. I only use a 20 degree sleeping bag and with the weather I kept warm over night, with other tents i would always wake up freezing but not with this one. 
Worth the upgrade to this 4 season pack-able tent if you plan on seeing snow/colder weather.
review.name: Tried 3 other brands before trying MSR tent.

review.reviewBody: I have used this tent in an ice storm, snow storm and cold-ish (15-25f) temps. It shrugged off the ice easily. It vented really well (minimal condensation), and it's quite warm. I am very pleased with the ease of set up. It's intuitive to the point that I was able to pitch it at night with stiff and frigid fingers. As advertised, it's footprint is small and I was able to find a space in thick forest. I have yet to experience any winds it couldn't handle. With the 4 guy-outs, it sunk into the ground like a limpet. Luckily, I am a side sleeper, so the lack of length (I am 6'2"") is okay. I will be heading up to some ridges this January in N.H. I have total confidence it will be fine.
review.name: Delivers as advertised

review.reviewBody: For a single person 4 season tent this one comes in at a very light weight and packability. It's easy to set up. Taking down can be more challenging requiring hot water. During a 3 day white out conditions storm on top of a mountain I hunkered down. After storm finished I had a hard time being able to disassemble the tent due to the canopy straps being frozen. This design requires those straps to be pliable in order to install or remove canopy. Once saturated and frozen they are rigid and difficult to release. Without hot water I would have to otherwise had to cut straps or abandon the tent. I feel like the tent poles could be split into two pieces and redesigned with a connection that would marry to two. It's roomy inside height wise and has a mini vestibule. I found about a 15Â° warmer temperature difference from inside to outside as it holds heat well and any moisture you feed it. Ultimately I see this best used for short dry winter camping trips. I don't recommend for storms where accumulation of snow will occur. The tent won't be able vent and it'll rain inside. In the end I see myself using this for a thru hike of the CDT as best applied use.
review.name: Best Applied Use

review.reviewBody: Sweet, petite, and neat.... for those solo journeys where a light load and low space in your pack are desired. It keeps the wind and rain out.
review.name: I like mine..

review.reviewBody: I use this product Guiding in the Beartooth Mountains of Montana. There is certainly a lot of room as a single person tent, id imagine two can squeeze no problem for a night or two on fast and light missions. There is no shortage of wind and rain storms in the Beartooths. It holds up well in the rain keeping you completely dry but has trouble with wind. There seems to be too many tie downs and I cant get the vestibule door to tension just right. While the footprint of the body is small, the fly and tie downs end up with a much bigger footprint. Set up time also seems to be longer then I expected. Although, I am biased coming from a very simple BD Firstlight where there are only 4 tie downs and set up time is minimal.
review.name: I would try out the MSR Advanced Pro 2

name: Access 1 Tent: 1-Person 4-Season

review.reviewBody: The shoe fits great and is very comfortable and looks great!
review.name: Very Comfortable !

review.reviewBody: Comfortable and feel great on my feet. They look good and I got nice comments on them from others.
review.name: Love these shoes

review.reviewBody: I have been using Altras for several years, completing my first ultra in them and hiking around 1200 miles without any problems. Recently, I transitioned to Hoka for their durability and to experience the popular choice. However, after just three runs, I began to experience shin splints, forcing me to pause my training. While I find the shoes to be exceptional, my only concern is the injury, which coincided with this change in footwear. Nevertheless, I remain optimistic about the shoes.
review.name: Great shoes but, shin splints.

review.reviewBody: I have owned the SG 3 and 4. Loved both for the mountains in Colorado. Great shoes and good durability. Absolutely love both, 4>3 but both great. The 5's......not so much. Feet are killing me after 10-16 miles, great toenail lifted and low back pain. Shoe feels sloppy. Have to use heel lock lacing to use for any down hill. Eight mile downhill is a nightmare. Bring back the the 4s. Can't find any anywhere. Just bought a pair of 6s, have 110 miles on the 5s and hoping the 6s are better.
review.name: NO

review.reviewBody: In the beginning, I used Under Armour shoes for 5ks and Races. But ever since I've got into Hoka's shoes. Without a doubt would buy these types of shoes, especially this particular shoe. This shoe is an excellent, quality design, and is amazing for training in the gravel or grass. I would buy this product again!
review.name: I would buy this product again

review.reviewBody: I purchased one pair of Seedgoat 5's and two pairs of Speedgoat 6's (all different colors). I have had operations on both feet and cannot with any comfort wear golf shoes. I use these for golf and my feet do not hurt at all. The tread keeps be stable during the golf swing. I will never go back to golf shoes!
review.name: Great Shoe for Golf

review.reviewBody: Honestly bought these for work. My goodness, never felt more comfortable, more ergonomic, I felt a difference in my back poster. I felt like I was walking on a cloud, that had massive grip, and very aggressive look! These always get great attention, and good for people that work overnight at Frito-Lay! Recommend 1000/10!
review.name: Shoe fanatic, these are something else...

review.reviewBody: A couple of major issues. First is that they are not suitable for technical/rocky, trails. The bottom of the shoe (middle heel area) that doesn't have tread, is basically made of marshmellow and is incredibly thin. You basically feel barefoot if you step on a rock in that location. If you are running on jagged or lose rock, it is really really painful and dangerous. When pushing with my finger, it wouldn't require much pressure to poke right through the bottom of the shoe. Similar lack of durability to the soles of the shoe. They are shredded beyond belief. Likely my last pair of trail runner Hokas as the durability is just not up to par.
review.name: Not suitable for rocky/technical terrain

review.reviewBody: I've been purchasing Hoka trail running shoes for years and have come to expect a level of durability these shoes don't live up to. After relatively minor use (weekend hikes for 4 months) the tread has separated from the sole, worn way too fast, and the material hasn't held up to minor scuffing and abrasions. These are the last Hoka's I'll be purchasing.
review.name: These are not durable enough for real trail use

review.reviewBody: This is an early review. ~25 miles hiking/running/scrambling in the Wasatch and Moab. First impression upon stepping in was awesome. Bio feedback counts for lots in performance apparel. I have barely wide feet by technical standards. The footbed shape fits so well. It fits just right as compared to the Tecton x2 (too snug) and Mafate Speed 4 (a little play). The SG5 stretch upper material is not as protective as the upper material on the MS4. But it provides uniform gentle compression that eliminates slippage inside the shoe when off camber, which inspires mad confidence. So does the Mega Grip outsole. I felt glued to the slick rock in Moab. I get equivalent comfort from the SG5 single piece midsole as I do from the MS4 dual layer. My only criticism of the SG5 is the thin tongue sometimes slips a little; same as the Tx2, but nonexistent in the chonkier MS4 tongue. I'd put a MS4 tongue in the SG5 to make it a perfect trail shoe. Though it's pretty close as is.
review.name: Excellent fast in the mtns shoe

name: Speedgoat 5 Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I just got RUX utility hooks for my RUX 70s so I could get them up on my garage's slat wall and I'm absolutely stoked. First of all, they are super-easy to put on - just back out the screw a couple turns, slide them onto the rail, tighten the screw and you're in business. They're low-profile, so I can still use my RUX as usual. And when I get home, the utility hooks are an absolute game-changer - basically creates invisible shelves for my RUX (and all my gear inside). Hot tip - install the utility hooks on whatever side makes it easiest to see into the clear window on the RUX in case you forget what's inside.
review.name: Garage Game Changer

name: Utility Hooks

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak All-Weather Low 2 Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I used these for many 10-mile walks and hikes through the summer. Because of many comments about them being too snug, I sized up and wore with thin socks to accommodate the water proof liner. They stretched after a few days' wear and now I can wear with any socks. They're the happy place for my feet!
review.name: Worked great for a summer of walking and hiking

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak All-Weather Low 2 Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I mountain biked up Kilimanjaro and summited in these shoes. I absolutely love them. They were sturdy and dried quick. They were a great option for my trip. I now use them for hiking but can't wait to try them for trail running.
review.name: I would buy these again!

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak All-Weather Low 2 Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: The fit is great, they are comfortable everything about that is great! HOWEVER , they hold moisture in them and so now whenever I wear them when I take them off my socks are that yucky moisture feeling, my feet look like they have been soaking in bath water too long. I've tried air drying them, I've tried the actual dryer but anytime I wear these shoes my feet are wet.
review.name: Worse shoe yet

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak All-Weather Low 2 Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Always wear Long Peak, have bought for several years, always a size 7. Just got these in same size and they feel too small. Hoping they might stretch out a bit?
review.name: Feels smaller

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak All-Weather Low 2 Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I use these are my favorite everyday walking shoes. The grip is is perfect on a gravel path with high hills. My feet are the happiest in these shoes.
review.name: Yes

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak All-Weather Low 2 Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: As a dog walker, I have been looking for water proof shoes for 20 years and finally found them!
review.name: These are the MOST comfortable water proof shoes!

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak All-Weather Low 2 Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love the new fit for the Lone Peak shoes, as the old fit was a bit wide for me. I only gave them 4 stars because I am really unhappy about the fact that they have shortened the laces by several inches. Now its impossible to use the last holes to tighten the fit or double knot to keep the round laces from untying. It seems wrong that I have to buy additional laces after spending a lot for these shoes!
review.name: Great shoes

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak All-Weather Low 2 Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I normally wear a regular Lone Peak and a size 7 fits perfectly. I have 5 pairs of size 7. I thought this all weather shoe would be good to have but the 7 was much too tight at the ball of my foot. The 7 1/2 felt OK for the forefoot but then my heel was sliding around unless I laced it so tight it was uncomfortable. I took them back.
review.name: The fit is very different from the regular Lone Peak

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak All-Weather Low 2 Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is 1 of 2 Altra (or any wide toe box) that I can wear w/no extra pain on my heel from PF. They do feel a smidge bigger in the heel than others but tying laces tighter at ankle fixes that.
review.name: One of two styles that don't hurt!

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak All-Weather Low 2 Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Seriously disappointed with Altra shoes this year - the construction and design are horrible I've tried every hiking boot and shoe this year and have returned them all and I am a diehard Altra fan, which is why I was so determined to just find one option. And don't even get me started on the hideous colors and designs for women we do not want Barney colors or any other outrageous combo we want a everyday color that goes with everything like the men's options - black and orange or black and blue, most of us are outdoorsy and we want shoes that won't show everything and don't scream girly.
review.name: What is going on

name: Lone Peak All-Weather Low 2 Hiking Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I don't write reviews.  I only write complaints.  But the Fasthouse Crossline 2.0 shorts totally freaking blew me away!

Burly without being too heavy.  Stout snaps and zippers.  Absolutely LOVE the design and fit -- not too tight, not too baggy.  I found them pretty much true to size.

I ordered EIGHT pairs of mountain bike shorts from Backcountry.  Sent seven back -- THESE are the ones I kept!
review.name: THESE SHORTS ARE RAD!!!

description: Buy the Fjallraven Kaitum Fleece Jacket - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Kaitum Fleece Jacket - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fjallraven Kaitum Fleece Jacket - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Without a doubt, this 60% wool fleece is warmer than strictly synthetic fleece. It’s also fairly light, with nice drape, and the jacket is cut longer and leaner than some brands, which adds to its warmth. Very pleased with this jacket; if you expect clothes to actually be functional, you’ll feel like this jacket is well worth the price.
review.name: Warm! Great texture and fit!

review.reviewBody: I am thrilled with this beautiful, warm and stylish jacket. Ordered my regular size (M) and crossed my fingers it would be long enough in sleeves and length for my 5’10” frame. Love, love, LOVE this company’s attention to detail, craftsmanship and pieces.
review.name: Twelve stars

review.reviewBody: Please get the XXL back in deep forest! Love my old one!
review.name: Great! Need more xxl

review.reviewBody: I have had this jacket for at least 2 years and it has held up well. I wear it throughout the year: at work (in the hospital), camping and just out and about. I wash it regularly and hang it up to dry. It still looks great with very minimal pilling.  I would get another in a different color. I agree that it could be less itchy but I am not bothered by it. I have worn it layered under another jacket as well. For me, this is a great layering piece.
review.name: One of my favorites

review.reviewBody: I really wanted to love it. It is warm and cozy, but after one wash it started to pill really badly and it doesn’t look nice anymore. I leave large pieces of wool everywhere I go. I’d think Fjallraven would make better quality products for this price. I’m very disappointed.
review.name: Pills after one wash

review.reviewBody: I’ve owned this jacket for about 5 months and I love the fit and feel. It does pill a bit but wool will do that.
review.name: Worth It

review.reviewBody: I love all of Fjallraven's stuff, and this item is no different. The wool makes a difference in the warmth level. Wearing this with a light puffer in the teens is still a warm experience. I'm a large in their jackets and the medium fit for this fleece, but the large was more comfortable and still flattering. I'm 5'6, 145lbs curvy. Love this!
review.name: So Warm

review.reviewBody: Great everyday fleece keeps my wife warm at work on cold days.
review.name: Great fit, great color and warm!

name: Kaitum Fleece Jacket - Women's
